required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Delayed Cord Clamping at Birth and Neonatal Bilirubin Levels in Parturients With a Prior Child Requiring Therapy for Neonatal Jaundice
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial to Evaluate the Relationship Between Delayed Cord Clamping at Birth and Neonatal Bilirubin Levels in Parturients With a Prior Child Requiring Therapy for Neonatal Jaundice

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine if neonates (who already have an increased risk of hyperbilirubinemia due to mother's history of having previous neonate who received phototherapy for hyperbilirubinemia) have higher bilirubin levels 24 hours after birth with delayed cord clamping.

secondary_outcome.description: Hyperbilirubinemia is a condition in which there is too much bilirubin in the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of neonates with a need for phototherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to up to 1 week after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of neonates with a need for exchange transfusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to up to 1 week after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of neonates admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to up to 1 week after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of mothers with postpartum hemorrhage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to up to 1 week after birth

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of neonates re-hospitalized for jaundice
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to up to 1 week after birth

intervention.description: The umbilical cord will be clamped after 60 seconds after birth
The umbilical cord will be clamped as soon as feasible after birth, usually within the initial 15 seconds after birth.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- mothers delivering at 35 weeks or greater
- mothers who have had at least 1 previous child that received phototherapy for hyperbilirubinemia
- multiple gestations can be included unless the neonate does not meet criteria for delayed cord clamping as described below or due to concerns about safety of delayed cord clamping for timing of delivery of the 2nd twin (ie: 2nd twin requires immediate delivery intervention)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neonates who do not meet criteria for delayed cord clamping (any infant that any provider in the room felt needed evaluation by the neonatal transport team immediately so that the infant would be handed off for resuscitation. If the patient required delivery by cesarean section the delayed cord clamping protocol would be abandoned).

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
